@Joksas, if you're using Windows 7, try right-clicking the .exe file for the game and setting compatibility mode to Vista with SP2. I had this problem with Crysis and it worked like a charm.

Also, if you still can't use BioShock 2 with Windows 7 64-bit, try running it in compatibility mode for Windows 2000. Worked for me!

Also, is there a crack for the updated version of BioShock 2? Because I happen to have a working key (No, you can't have it), and I really want to be able to use it.

Guys, I was having problems with this before, but I stupidly realized that there is actually a difference between the SP and the MP folder.
A lot of people didn't realize it at first, but make sure you use the SP folder. >Single Player, Multi Player.
